conclusion: Objects A and B are stacked, force F applied to A, surface below B is smooth, friction between A and B.
Figure 2 shows linear relationship between acceleration a and force F.
Only horizontal forces are applied force F on A and frictional force between A and B.
Graph shows F = 0, a = 0 and F = 60 N, a = 8 m/s².
Relationship is linear: a = F/7.5.
Define m₁ = mass of A, m₂ = mass of B, μₖ = coefficient of kinetic friction, f = friction force.
Equation for object A: F - f = m₁a.
Equation for object B: f = m₂a.
Friction force f = μₖ × m₁g.
From equations: F - μₖm₁g = m₁a and μₖm₁g = m₂a.
m₂ = μₖm₁g/a.
Substitute a = F/7.5 into F - μₖm₁g = m₁a.
Simplify to: (7.5 - m₁/F)F = 7.5μₖm₁g.
Use point from graph: F = 48, a = 6.
Confirm relationship: a = F/8.
From equation (2): 10μₖm₁ = 6m₂.
Substitute a = F/7.5 into F - μₖm₁g = m₁a.
Simplify to: F(7.5 - m₁) = 75μₖm₁.
For entire system: F = (m₁ + m₂)a.
Since a = F/7.5, 7.5 = m₁ + m₂.
